intro: Crepidomanes grande, commonly known as the large wall-rue, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Berberidaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces bright red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Native to parts of Europe and Asia, it thrives in woodland and rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and sometimes invasive species in certain regions.
